73// Compiles the wrapper for this (kind, sig) pair and sets the corresponding
74// cache entry. Assumes the key already exists in the cache but has not been
75// compiled yet.
76V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE
77WasmCode* CompileImportWrapper(
78 NativeModule* native_module, Counters* counters, ImportCallKind kind,
79 const FunctionSig* sig, uint32_t canonical_type_index, int expected_arity,
80 Suspend suspend, WasmImportWrapperCache::ModificationScope* cache_scope);

82// Triggered by the WasmCompileLazy builtin. The return value indicates whether
83// compilation was successful. Lazy compilation can fail only if validation is
84// also lazy.
85bool CompileLazy(Isolate*, Tagged<WasmTrustedInstanceData>, int func_index);
86
87// Throws the compilation error after failed lazy compilation.
88void ThrowLazyCompilationError(Isolate* isolate,
89 const NativeModule* native_module,
90 int func_index);
91
92// Trigger tier-up of a particular function to TurboFan. If tier-up was already
93// triggered, we instead increase the priority with exponential back-off.
94V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void TriggerTierUp(Isolate*, Tagged<WasmTrustedInstanceData>,
95 int func_index);
96// Synchronous version of the above.
97void TierUpNowForTesting(Isolate*, Tagged<WasmTrustedInstanceData>,
98 int func_index);
99// Same, but all functions.
100V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void TierUpAllForTesting(Isolate*,
101 Tagged<WasmTrustedInstanceData>);

103template <typename Key, typename KeyInfo, typename Hash>
104class WrapperQueue {
105 public:
106 // Removes an arbitrary key from the queue and returns it.
107 // If the queue is empty, returns nullopt.
108 // Thread-safe.
109 base::Optional<std::pair<Key, KeyInfo>> pop() {
110 base::Optional<std::pair<Key, KeyInfo>> key = base::nullopt;
111 base::MutexGuard lock(&mutex_);
112 auto it = queue_.begin();
113 if (it != queue_.end()) {
114 key = *it;
115 queue_.erase(it);
116 }
117 return key;
118 }
119
120 // Add the given key to the queue and returns true iff the insert was
121 // successful.
122 // Not thread-safe.
123 bool insert(const Key& key, KeyInfo key_info) {
124 return queue_.insert({key, key_info}).second;
125 }
126
127 size_t size() {
128 base::MutexGuard lock(&mutex_);
129 return queue_.size();
130 }
131
132 private:
133 base::Mutex mutex_;
134 std::unordered_map<Key, KeyInfo, Hash> queue_;
135};
136
137// Encapsulates all the state and steps of an asynchronous compilation.
138// An asynchronous compile job consists of a number of tasks that are executed
139// as foreground and background tasks. Any phase that touches the V8 heap or
140// allocates on the V8 heap (e.g. creating the module object) must be a
141// foreground task. All other tasks (e.g. decoding and validating, the majority
142// of the work of compilation) can be background tasks.
143// TODO(wasm): factor out common parts of this with the synchronous pipeline.
144class AsyncCompileJob {
145 public:
146 AsyncCompileJob(Isolate* isolate, WasmFeatures enabled_features,
147 CompileTimeImports compile_imports,
148 base::OwnedVector<const uint8_t> bytes,
149 Handle<Context> context,
150 Handle<NativeContext> incumbent_context,
151 const char* api_method_name,
152 std::shared_ptr<CompilationResultResolver> resolver,
153 int compilation_id);
154 ~AsyncCompileJob();
155
156 void Start();
157
158 std::shared_ptr<StreamingDecoder> CreateStreamingDecoder();
159
160 void Abort();
161 void CancelPendingForegroundTask();
162
163 Isolate* isolate() const { return isolate_; }
164
165 Handle<NativeContext> context() const { return native_context_; }
166 v8::metrics::Recorder::ContextId context_id() const { return context_id_; }
167
168 private:
169 class CompileTask;
170 class CompileStep;
171 class CompilationStateCallback;
172
173 // States of the AsyncCompileJob.
174 // Step 1 (async). Decodes the wasm module.
175 // --> Fail on decoding failure,
176 // --> PrepareAndStartCompile on success.
177 class DecodeModule;
178
179 // Step 2 (sync). Prepares runtime objects and starts background compilation.
180 // --> finish directly on native module cache hit,
181 // --> finish directly on validation error,
182 // --> trigger eager compilation, if any; FinishCompile is triggered when
183 // done.
184 class PrepareAndStartCompile;
185
186 // Step 3 (sync). Compilation finished. Finalize the module and resolve the
187 // promise.
188 class FinishCompilation;
189
190 // Step 4 (sync). Decoding, validation or compilation failed. Reject the
191 // promise.
192 class Fail;
193
194 friend class AsyncStreamingProcessor;
195
196 enum FinishingComponent { kStreamingDecoder, kCompilation };
197
198 // Decrements the number of outstanding finishers. The last caller of this
199 // function should finish the asynchronous compilation, see the comment on
200 // {outstanding_finishers_}.
201 V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT bool DecrementAndCheckFinisherCount(
202 FinishingComponent component) {
203 base::MutexGuard guard(&check_finisher_mutex_);
204 DCHECK_LT(0, outstanding_finishers_);
205 if (outstanding_finishers_-- == 2) {
206 // The first component finished, we just start a timer for a histogram.
207 streaming_until_finished_timer_.Start();
208 return false;
209 }
210 // The timer has only been started above in the case of streaming
211 // compilation.
212 if (streaming_until_finished_timer_.IsStarted()) {
213 // We measure the time delta from when the StreamingDecoder finishes until
214 // when module compilation finishes. Depending on whether streaming or
215 // compilation finishes first we add the delta to the according histogram.
216 int elapsed = static_cast<int>(
217 streaming_until_finished_timer_.Elapsed().InMilliseconds());
218 if (component == kStreamingDecoder) {
219 isolate_->counters()
220 ->wasm_compilation_until_streaming_finished()
221 ->AddSample(elapsed);
222 } else {
223 isolate_->counters()
224 ->wasm_streaming_until_compilation_finished()
225 ->AddSample(elapsed);
226 }
227 }
228 DCHECK_EQ(0, outstanding_finishers_);
229 return true;
230 }

232 void CreateNativeModule(std::shared_ptr<const WasmModule> module,
233 size_t code_size_estimate);
234 // Return true for cache hit, false for cache miss.
235 bool GetOrCreateNativeModule(std::shared_ptr<const WasmModule> module,
236 size_t code_size_estimate);
237 void PrepareRuntimeObjects();
238
239 void FinishCompile(bool is_after_cache_hit);
240
241 void Failed();
242
243 void AsyncCompileSucceeded(Handle<WasmModuleObject> result);
244
245 void FinishSuccessfully();
246
247 void StartForegroundTask();
248 void ExecuteForegroundTaskImmediately();
249
250 void StartBackgroundTask();
251
252 enum UseExistingForegroundTask : bool {
253 kUseExistingForegroundTask = true,
254 kAssertNoExistingForegroundTask = false
255 };
256 // Switches to the compilation step {Step} and starts a foreground task to
257 // execute it. Most of the time we know that there cannot be a running
258 // foreground task. If there might be one, then pass
259 // kUseExistingForegroundTask to avoid spawning a second one.
260 template <typename Step,
261 UseExistingForegroundTask = kAssertNoExistingForegroundTask,
262 typename... Args>
263 void DoSync(Args&&... args);
264
265 // Switches to the compilation step {Step} and immediately executes that step.
266 template <typename Step, typename... Args>
267 void DoImmediately(Args&&... args);
268
269 // Switches to the compilation step {Step} and starts a background task to
270 // execute it.
271 template <typename Step, typename... Args>
272 void DoAsync(Args&&... args);
273
274 // Switches to the compilation step {Step} but does not start a task to
275 // execute it.
276 template <typename Step, typename... Args>
277 void NextStep(Args&&... args);
278
279 Isolate* const isolate_;
280 const char* const api_method_name_;
281 const WasmFeatures enabled_features_;
282 const CompileTimeImports compile_imports_;
283 const DynamicTiering dynamic_tiering_;
284 base::TimeTicks start_time_;
285 // Copy of the module wire bytes, moved into the {native_module_} on its
286 // creation.
287 base::OwnedVector<const uint8_t> bytes_copy_;
288 // Reference to the wire bytes (held in {bytes_copy_} or as part of
289 // {native_module_}).
290 ModuleWireBytes wire_bytes_;
291 Handle<NativeContext> native_context_;
292 Handle<NativeContext> incumbent_context_;
293 v8::metrics::Recorder::ContextId context_id_;
294 v8::metrics::WasmModuleDecoded metrics_event_;
295 const std::shared_ptr<CompilationResultResolver> resolver_;
296
297 Handle<WasmModuleObject> module_object_;
298 std::shared_ptr<NativeModule> native_module_;
299
300 std::unique_ptr<CompileStep> step_;
301 CancelableTaskManager background_task_manager_;
302
303 std::shared_ptr<v8::TaskRunner> foreground_task_runner_;
304
305 // For async compilation the AsyncCompileJob is the only finisher. For
306 // streaming compilation also the AsyncStreamingProcessor has to finish before
307 // compilation can be finished.
308 int32_t outstanding_finishers_ = 1;
309 base::ElapsedTimer streaming_until_finished_timer_;
310 base::Mutex check_finisher_mutex_;
311
312 // A reference to a pending foreground task, or {nullptr} if none is pending.
313 CompileTask* pending_foreground_task_ = nullptr;
314
315 // The AsyncCompileJob owns the StreamingDecoder because the StreamingDecoder
316 // contains data which is needed by the AsyncCompileJob for streaming
317 // compilation. The AsyncCompileJob does not actively use the
318 // StreamingDecoder.
319 std::shared_ptr<StreamingDecoder> stream_;
320
321 // The compilation id to identify trace events linked to this compilation.
322 const int compilation_id_;
323};

326} // namespace internal
327} // namespace v8
